abstract.p: Gabe Jennings and Michael Stember finish first and second in 1,500 meters to lead Stanford to National Collegiate Athletic Association men's track and field title, breaking Arkansas' string of eight consecutive men's titles (S)

block.p: Gabe Jennings and Michael Stember of Stanford finished first and second in the 1,500 meters tonight to lead the Cardinal to the National Collegiate Athletic Association men's track and field title.
Stanford broke Arkansas' string of eight consecutive men's titles, scoring 72 points to the Razorbacks' 59.
Gabe Jennings and Michael Stember of Stanford finished first and second in the 1,500 meters tonight to lead the Cardinal to the National Collegiate Athletic Association men's track and field title.
Stanford broke Arkansas' string of eight consecutive men's titles, scoring 72 points to the Razorbacks' 59.
Jennings, a sophomore, won in 3 minutes 37.76 seconds, with Stember second in 3:39.53.

Louisiana State won its 12th women's title in 14 years, getting victories by Peta-Gaye Dowdie in the 200 meters, Joyce Bates in the 100-meter hurdles and Keisha Spencer in the triple jump. Bates edged Jenny Adams of Houston and won in 12.85 seconds. Dowdie won the 200 in 22.51 seconds and finished second in the 100 behind the defending champion, Angela Williams of Southern California.
Mikele Barber of South Carolina won the women's 400 meters in 51.14, and Avard Moncur of Auburn won the men's 400 in 44.72 seconds.
Angeliki Tsiolakoudi, 24, a freshman from the University of Texas at El Paso set a meet record of 197 feet 8 inches in winning the women's javelin.
